#summary One-sentence summary of this page.

= Prepare IDE and environment for work =

Short how-to about preparing IDE to work with our project.

= Download IDE and plugins =

Download newest version of eclipse for Java EE Developers from official site http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/. 

Install Google Plugin for Eclipse from software site:
http://dl.google.com/eclipse/plugin/3.7

Install Subversion plugin for eclipse (Subclipse) as described in official manual http://subclipse.tigris.org/servlets/ProjectProcess?pageID=p4wYuA.
Note: remember if you're using linux to install JavaHL package from repository!

= Download GWT FB Code for review =

Before we start coding it's good to know what are we dealing with. The best thing to do is to make a quick review of GWT FB code which is available on CodeGoogle or download its source and import to eclipse. 

GWT FB source is available on Github: https://github.com/olams/GwtFB

Note that GWT FB source will no work out of the box. You need to create new Webapp project and then pase code into project home directory!

= New to GWT? =

If your'e new to GWT the easiest way to start it's to complete SockWatcher Tutorial. You can find it here: http://code.google.com/intl/pl/webtoolkit/doc/1.6/tutorial/gettingstarted.html
